name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On the morning of the 17th, outside Stanley Prison in Hong Kong, a woman was beaten and taken away by several people in a van.
After receiving the alarm, the police immediately stopped the van and rescued the female victim 10 kilometers away, on the road opposite the Ocean Park Marriott Hotel. She was sent to the hospital with injuries to her head, hands and feet. Three men and one woman were arrested in the incident.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
It is reported that four men and women have been arrested in the incident, including two minors, a 16-year-old girl and a 17-year-old boy. In addition, a 30-year-old man named Dai and a 37-year-old driver named Liu were also arrested. All arrested persons were arrested on suspicion of illegal confinement and are currently being detained for investigation.
It is reported that the woman planned to go to prison this morning to visit her boyfriend who was sentenced to prison for dangerous driving, but she was abducted.

content:
Netizen contribution
In a community in Hefei, community workers placed health packs at residents' doorsteps for photos and then took them away. This scene happened to be captured by a camera

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Currently, on various domestic platforms, the epidemic prevention "amulet" that claims to prevent infection by sticking it on clothes is selling like hot cakes

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @NANNAN13505489 is indeed known as Japan's special research black technology

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: I have a question. Now that China has fully liberalized and no longer implemented a zero-COVID policy, can those who still demand a zero-COVID policy, constantly post negative news about the liberalization policy online, and slander China's epidemic prevention policy be called "anti-thieves"?

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
A hot topic in China recently: B station blogger Pa Xing Tian Xia posted that the survival situation of Xiao He, the largest saltwater crocodile donated by Taiwan to the mainland, is worrying. Today, a netizen went to visit but was stopped by the staff.
